name: Large Serving Platter-Tobago Island with Sun Bleached Tree
description:
♦ An original hand-painted larger serving platter for your Fine Art collection.

I've painted this fabulous large porcelain serving platter with a painting of Tobago which I visited in 2012. We went on a boat trip and stopped at a tiny island for lunch. There was this incredible tree with gnarled branches right on the edge of the water. The tree seemed so out of place on such a perfect tropical island. 

This painting is of the little tiny island, surrounded with warm perfectly blue water. The island was lush, full of exotic fruit trees, flowers and tropical birds, but this one tree, dry and sun-bleached desperately clung to the beach, trying not to be washed away. This tree made an impression on me and I've tried to capture the way I felt while looking at in this painting. 

While the platter is functional, it is meant mainly for decorative purposes. Special, occasional use with finger foods such as cheese, sushi or cookies and cup-cakes is encouraged. Do not use sharp serving utensils of any kind. This platter would be fabulous displayed hanging on your wall or as a decorative plate for your mantel or side table.

name: Hand-Painted Cake Stand-Claude Monet's: Oat and Poppy Field
description:
♦ An original hand-painted Cake Stand for your Fine Art collection.

I've painted this darling petite, porcelain cake stand with my interpretation of Claude Monet's: Oat and Poppy Field, Giverny 1890 

:: The cake stand is 4" inches tall and 8.25" inches wide
:: Hand-painted with non-toxic paint on Porcelain
:: The cake stand is functional, but is meant for decorative purposes
:: Clean with a soft damp cloth. Do not soak in water
:: Signed and dated on the base of the stand
:: Original and one of a kind

Over the years I've painted several oil and canvas studies of Monet and the various French Poppy Fields he's made so famous. His work is a style I've always been drawn towards. I first learned how to paint with oils by copying works of the Old Impressionist Masters such as Van Gogh, Monet, Renoir, Matisse and many more. I studied their works to learn about technique, color theory and the freedom of their impressionism brushstrokes. This is the first time I've ever painted one of the old Masters on porcelain. I hope to create a series of these pieces to pay homage to the artists who have helped teach me what I know today. 

You can see my other canvas paintings in my paintings gallery here: http://www.maryelizabetharts.com/?page/84283/painting-gallery

♥This is a painting that my dad and I created together. We both enjoy painting on our own but occasionally create big canvases together. Sometimes we'll paint side by side, one of use painting one half, while he paints the other, and then we'll switch sides. Or sometimes I'll paint a layer, and then he'll paint a layer and then we keep switching off until the painting is complete. These combined paintings are always a lot of fun, and since we both have different skill sets, we are able to create different types of paintings together that we never could on our own. We have both signed the canvas in the bottom right hand of the painting.
